definition: aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
star chart/also written 星相圖|星相图

sentences.english: Chinese astrology and constellations were often used for divination.
sentences.chinese: 中國星象學及星座常用於占卜。

sentences.english: This week, the planets blow the whistle on that people-pleasing behavior.
sentences.chinese: 這周的星象預示着一些取悅他人的行爲。

sentences.english: I don't believe in astrology or fortune-telling.
sentences.chinese: 我不相信星象學或是算命的。

sentences.english: The celestial energy can make you more guarded than usual.
sentences.chinese: 星象能量會使你比平常更加的具有防衛性。

sentences.english: After that, these powerful planets will say adieu and not meet again until 2022.
sentences.chinese: 在那之後，你在2022年前不會再見到這一星象了。

sentences.english: These unique round impressions have remained an unsolved mystery.
sentences.chinese: 有奇特的無字天書星象圖，留下了無數的不解之謎。

sentences.english: Zhu Yihua is already f with the 12 animal signs of the Chinese horoscope.
sentences.chinese: 朱意花早已熟悉中國星象中的12個動物生肖。

sentences.english: I've had days that seem to fit with my horoscope's predictions.
sentences.chinese: 我已經有好幾天似乎和我的星象預言相符合。

sentences.english: He gestured to the star chart whose connected constellations formed a four-winged bird.
sentences.chinese: 他指着把羣星連成四隻翅膀的鳥的星象圖。

sentences.english: Whoa... You guys are in an incredible place this week in Astro-land...
sentences.chinese: 這周你的星象位於不可思議的位置。

sentences.english: You should go to an astrologer to have your horoscope read.
sentences.chinese: 你應該找一個占星家，讓他告訴你你的星象。

sentences.english: They studied the stars and planets.

definition: meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
seven heavenly bodies and four imaginary stars (in astrology and feng shui)
